etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in James Lee (1715–1795), nurseryman. From scientific Latin Canarium, genus name from Ambonese Malay kanari

definitions: Any of various large tropical or subtropical evergreen trees of the genus Canarium (family Burseraceae), native to Africa, South-East Asia, Australia, and the Pacific Islands; (in form Canarium) the genus itself.

notes.text: Species of Canarium are cultivated or exploited for their wood, resin, essential oils, and edible fruit and seeds.
